Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2017 06:16AM GirlWarrior wrote: Hello, original diagnosis January 2015, Stage 3 Stage 4 in August 2016 with "innumerable mets to bones" and mets to brain and cfs in October 2016
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? zarovka SimonH

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2016 07:33AM GirlWarrior wrote: Thank you so much, for your advice, personal sharing and wisdom. I have read each of your posts several times, and have quietlly reflected on your words. I dont't have any answers. I hope for some repreive, or some stability, but I am no longer being treated so it would be naive to think so. I had an mri and ct scan on Friday to document progression. I tthink this will give me some information that I can share with my daughter. My daughter has been honest with me and said will not talk about it with anyone - she believes she will become a spectacle. At least now I can understand her resistance. i am trying to role model for her, even in this difficult time - I don't know if she will ever remember. I hope so

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2016 10:21PM GirlWarrior wrote: Sending out a wish of love and support for all the Mom's who are carrying their children through this holiday season. The mixture of emotions is quite overwhelming and I have such respectfor all the children who are living with cancer in their family. I only hope to be as brave as my kids are.

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2016 07:05PM GirlWarrior wrote: This is a great article. I had a mastectomy with a reduction on the other side at the same time. I asked for no bigger than a B but I was left with a D. I would give anything to go back and just take it down to an A- . I do not enjoy the hassle of trying to constantly balance my chest, and would love to just slip in to a little padded sport bra and a tank top. I never once missed my breast, it was so weird - I just could not imagine do anything else invasive to my body. Caveat - just my experince, certainly not "the right" one, but was weird that it was one of the few times in my life Ihad no conflict with a big decision.
Posts.Title: Great article in NY Times about Choosing No Reconstruction woodstock99 GirlWarrior
